AppConfig.Definition.Intro: The app-package definition is important when exporting/importing this app.
AppConfig.Definition.Title: App Package Definition
AppConfig.Export.Intro: Create an app-package (zip) which can be installed in another portal
AppConfig.Export.Title: Export this entire App
AppConfig.Intro: Configure the App and special App-settings here.
AppConfig.Resources.Intro: Resources are used for labels and things like that in the App. They are usually needed to create multi-lingual views and such, and should not be used for App-Settings.
AppConfig.Resources.Title: App Resources
AppConfig.Settings.Intro: Settings are configurations used by the app - like SQL-connection strings, default "items-to-show" numbers and things like that. They can also be multi-language, so that a setting (like default RSS-Feed) could be different in each language.
AppConfig.Settings.Title: App Settings
AppConfig.Title: App Configuration
AppManagement.Prompt.DeleteApp: This cannot be undone. To really delete this app, type (or copy/paste) the app-name here: sure you want to delete '{{name}}' ({{id}}) ?
AppManagement.Prompt.FailedDelete: input did not match - will not delete
AppManagement.Prompt.NewApp: Enter App Name (will also be used for folder)
AppManagement.Table.Name: Name
AppManagement.Title: Manage Apps in this Zone (Portal)
Edit.Fields.Hyperlink.Default.SponsoredL: Adam is sponsored with ♥ by 2sic.com
Edit.Fields.Hyperlink.PagePicker.Title: Select a web page
ImportExport.Export.FurtherHelp: For further help visit 2sxc Help.
ImportExport.Export.Intro: This is an advanced export feature to export parts of this Content / App. It will create an XML-file for you which you can import into another site or App
ImportExport.Export.Title: Partial Export of Content Types, Template Configuration and Content
ImportExport.FurtherHelp: For further help visit 2sxc Help.
ImportExport.Import.Explanation: This import will add Content-Types, Templates and Content-Items to the current Content or App.
ImportExport.Import.Title: Import a content export (.zip) or a partial export (.xml)
ImportExport.Intro: Create an xml or zip containing parts of this app, to import into another app or content. Or import such a parts-package.
ImportExport.Title: Export or Import parts of this App/Content
Language.Intro: Manage the enabled / disable languages for this Zone (this portal)
Language.Title: Languages / Cultures
Main.Portal.Intro: These settings apply to all content and all apps within this portal.
Main.Portal.Title: Settings for the entire portal
Main.Title: Administration
Portal.Rename: Note to 2tk - rename is not necessary any more, don't implement!
Portal.Title: Virtual Database (VDB)
ReorderContentList.Intro: Sort by dragging as you need, then save
ReorderContentList.Title: Re-order list of content-items
ReplaceContent.Intro: By replacing a content-item you can make a other content appear in the slot of the original content.
ReplaceContent.Title: Replace Content Item
TemplateEdit.Title: Edit Template
Templates.InfoHideAdvanced: Improve the user experience for the content-editor by hiding advanced features from him. If your portal contains a security role called “2sxc designers”, then non-members will not see buttons like Edit Template or Manage Templates. How-To documented here.
Templates.Title: Manage Templates
WebAPIData.unused.Intro: Use the query designer to create complex queries. They can be used in normal templates (Token/Razor) or in JavaScript. Or you can create your custom JSON-WebAPI which is only for JavaScript - for example to save something, retrieve a file or perform a query too complex for the designer. Read more about coding data pipelines and about using the data in JavaScript with jQuery, AngularJS and more.
WebAPIData.unused.Title: Get content as if it were data for your template or JavaScript
WebAPIData.unused.Visual.Intro: Use the Visual Query Designer (Pipeline-Designer) to create queries to data from 2sxc, SQL, RSS and more.
WebAPIData.unused.Visual.Title: Visual Data Query
WebApi.AddDoesntExist: there is no automatic add yet - please do it manually in the 'api' folder. Just copy one of an existing project to get started.
WebApi.Intro: Create a WebApi within minutes by placing the source code in the folder called API and inheriting the correct interface. Try it out by creating one automatically and pressing here. Read more about the WebApi or the C# data editing API.
WebApi.ListTitle: The following list shows the .cs files in the App-API folder:
WebApi.QuickStart: For a quick start, we recommend that you install the WebApi demo-app. It contains some WebAPI controllers with various actions and some example views to use these controllers. Download WebApi demos in the App-Catalog or read more about it in help
WebApi.Title: WebApi for this App
